title: ‘Vigilante pedophile sting went wrong after target kidnapped child “bait” and sped off’
text:
A girl used as ‘bait’ to try and trap a suspected pedophile ended up being abducted by her target, sheriff’s deputies say (File photo)

A vigilante group’s attempt to snare a suspected pedophile backfired after their target kidnapped a teenager used to bait him, sheriff’s deputies say.

The gang used social media to contact a man seeking sex with underage girls – named as Robert Dreyfus – to arrange a meeting, it is claimed.

The group of an 18 year-old and two 17 year-olds arranged to meet Dreyfus, 32, at a Starbucks in Vista, California, on Sunday afternoon, it is alleged.

Once there, Dreyfus reportedly persuaded one of the 17 year-old girls to get into his car for a chat – then drove off without her permission, deputies say.

That prompted the kidnapped girl to text friends begging for help, with her fellow vigilantes then calling 911.

The girl is said to have agreed to meet with suspect Robert Dreyfus at this Starbucks in East Vista, California – only for him to persuade her to get into his car, then drive off (Picture: Google Maps)

Deputies from San Diego County Sheriff’s Department were able to contact Dreyfus on his phone, and he pulled over around two miles away, police say.

The girl, who is a year under the age of consent in California, was rescued unharmed, the San Diego Union Tribune reported.

Dreyfus was arrested on suspicion of kidnapping, sending harmful information to a minor and communication with a minor for specific offenses.

Explaining the intended plan, sheriff’s department spokesman Sergeant David LaDieu said: ‘The group hoped to expose the male and turn over the information to law enforcement agencies for prosecution.’

In recent years, ‘pedophile hunter’ groups have shot to fame after setting up sting operations to ensnare suspected pedophiles, then filming and sharing the moment their target realizes they’ve been set up.
description: Robert Dreyfus is said to have persuaded the child used to lure him to get into his car in Vista, California
